facts.f: Tendulkar and Kohli only Indians to win MVP awards.
Delhi Daredevils is the only team that had never played an IPL Final.
Chennai Super Kings is the only team in IPL that has never changed its captain.
In every IPL Season, RCB promotes “Go Green” initiative by wearing green jersey for a match.
Sachin Tendulkar becomes the first Indian player to win an orange cap in IPL.
Virat Kohli holds the record of most runs in one IPL Season. He has made 973 runs in IPL 2016.
Ishant Sharma holds the record of conceding most runs in an innings. He conceded 66 runs in 4 overs against CSK in IPL 2013.
Shaun Marsh becomes the first orange cap holder in the inaugural season (2008) of IPL.
Chris Gayle and David Warner have won orange cap twice in the history of IPL.
Sohail Tanvir becomes the first purple cap holder in the inaugural season (2008) of IPL.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar (SRH) is the only bowler to have won the purple cap twice in IPL history.
Mujeeb Ur Rahman(16) is the youngest player in the history of IPL.
Brad Hogg(45) is the oldest player in the history of IPL.
In 2015, Parthiv Patel becomes the first Indian player who plays for 6 IPL franchises.
Zaheer Khan is the only player who is a part of the very 1st game and 500th game of the IPL.
David Warner holds the record for most half-centuries in IPL (36).
Chris Gayle also holds the record for winning man of the match award, most number of times in IPL (20).
Chris Gayle also holds the record for most sixes by a batsman in IPL history.
Kings XI Punjab is the only team that has changed its captain 11 times in 11 seasons of IPL.
